Sparkt Marty Griffin - GET MARTY  has partnered with Chaffin Luhana Foundation, Oakmont Bakery, Nation's Best Meat Wholesalers, Lamagna Cheese, UTZ Quality Foods INC., Sam's Club, Oakmont Deli, Bird Dog's Sports Bar & Grill, 412 Food Rescue, and Audio Visual Productions to help feed people in the Pittsburgh area during these trying times.

Time: Will assess again on Monday, March 23 if giving away food again
PublicNotes:
Check Facebook for updates.

Monteverde’s Produce has donated fresh produce to our grocery store. We will be setting up outside of the Café TODAY for folks to come and take what they need FOR FREE- NO QUESTIONS ASKED. We will be monitoring safe distances so you can pick up your FREE produce quickly and safely. Please take advantage of this if you need food or have been put in a financial pinch.

PLEASE NOTE: We are a small business as well so if you are not in need financially but have grocery and food needs, please consider shopping our groceries located on our website for carryout or delivery.

SAFETY RULES:
- YOU MUST WEAR GLOVES! (We will provide them for you)
- ONE AT A TIME!
- THE NEXT PERSON IN LINE MUST STAND AT THE FIRST TAPE MARK! (6 FEET OF SAFE DISTANCE)
- EVERY PERSON IN LINE WILL NEED TO STAND AT A 6 FOOT TAPE MARK!
- DO NOT GO TO THE NEXT TAPE MARK OR SHOP THE TABLE UNTIL THE PREVIOUS PERSON HAS FULLY LEFT THE AREA!
GO HOME, WASH YOUR HANDS, WASH YOUR PRODUCE, AND ENJOY!

Time: Tuesdays: noon-1pm
PublicNotes: Please call to schedule a pick up at 412-561-7551
Population_Served: SHIM site - Serving Baldwin/Whitehall, Bethel Park, South Park, Keystone Oaks, Mt Lebanon, Upper St Clair

Time: taking orders at all times. we will call you to confirm your pick up.
PublicNotes:
We are no longer operating as a restaurant. Instead, your favorite space where friendly paths intersect is now the place where you can order food, beverage, and household items that you will need to get you through this time. Many items will be available to you at no cost. 

Look through our inventory under “order here”. If you need something that isn’t listed, send us an email. We will work to find it for you. 

Once you place your order, wait for a call from us. We will walk you through our pick up procedure, and schedule your pickup time with everyone’s safety in mind. 

We are working on being able to accept orders for delivery and ACCESS payments. When those are available, we will let you know.

Time: anytime
PublicNotes: Pittsburgh is the city that welcomed my husband and I as immigrants in 1985- it’s the city that raised my two wonderful children. In these trying times it’s critical that we all look out for the most vulnerable in our community. If you are a senior or know of a senior in need of a meal in the North Hills, please contact me and we will arrange for a free lunch/dinner to be delivered to their home or available to be picked up. And if you are a family that’s struggling, please reach out as well- You have all supported our business through good times and bad, now is our chance to do the same.

SITE_specific_location: Pantry box is located on the front porch of the house.  It can be accessed any time - no appointment is needed.  Please note that some foods may be brought inside at night (e.g., canned and jarred goods) if the temperature drops below freezing - this is to ensure food safety.  If you are in need of particular items (e.g., baby products) or have special food needs (e.g., allergies, celiac, etc.), you can email us at hatefreedormont@gmail.com and we will do our best to source items for you and schedule a pick-up time.
Time: The pantry box is available 24/7, no appointments are needed.  Please note that some foods may not be available if the temperature is too low or high for food safety reasons since this is an outdoor location.
PublicNotes:
We rely on donations, but have tried to encourage donors to give the following items:
-Bags of rice, bags/boxes of beans and rice mix (e.g., red beans and rice)
-Canned vegetables, fruits, and soups
-Cereals, oats, and shelf stable milk
-Mac and cheese, pasta, and jarred sauce
-Individually wrapped rolls of toilet paper
-Hygiene products including soaps, shampoos, toothpaste, tooth brushes, and menstrual pads
-Snacks (e.g., goldfish crackers, snack packs)

SITE_specific_location: From Butler Street, head north (towards the Allegheny River) onto 51st Street. Turn right as if accessing the parking lot for Thriftique / Allegheny Health Network. Follow driveway to rear of building. The food distribution location is in the rear of that building, by the loading docks, in the approximate middle of the building.
Time: Friday afternoons. Please call Lawrenceville United at 412-802-7220 by 11 a.m. on Fridays to get on our list to receive a box of food. Leave your number and we will call you when it's ready.
PublicNotes:
We are practicing social distancing. Please maintain 6 feet distance from us and others at all times. We ask you remain in your vehicle and pop the trunk and we will load the box directly into the trunk. 

We receive the donations from Whole Foods through 412 Food Rescue. We can't anticipate what will come and how much.
Volunteer_Info: We need volunteers to help pack the boxes and deliver it to higher risk populations in Lawrenceville.

SITE_specific_location: Distributed from the Knights of Columbus hall. During COVID-19, distribution occurs at building entrance. Accessible location.
Time: Monthly distribution. Occurs on third Saturday of each month. Doors open at 1 pm. (Line typically starts by 12:30). Food is usually gone by 1:30 pm. We partner with 412 Food Rescue and regularly receive donations to share with the community.
PublicNotes: We provide fresh produce through this program. Typically, based on donations, we have a mix of potatoes, carrots, peppers, oranges, bananas, apples and lettuce. We also provide health/hygiene products at this event through a sister program called Cosmetics Closet. We often have soap, shampoo, toilet paper - usually we focus on one item/month.
Population_Served: Open to any adult. You do not have to live in Natrona to be eligible. You do not have to show proof of income. One distribution/household.

PublicNotes: For intake, call the non-profit. They work to prevent hunger in families and offer resources to meet this need.
Stop by to receive perishable items such as meats and vegetables, meals, and groceries. There is food for those in an emergency as well as the elderly, among others.
The ministry may have baby goods, meals, and referrals to human service and public aid.
Food is available along with emergency financial aid, shelter, and home delivered meals for senior citizens in Allegheny. Volunteers assist the working poor and help children as well.
The homeless can get a meal, warm winter coat, boots, and other needs met.
Runs a thrift store, clothing, offers meals to the low income, elderly, and homeless, and a number of other government and state assistance programs.

Call to learn about various assistance programs, both financial and others such as food, thrift stores, and clothing. Case management can help people apply for state of Pennsylvania and federal government assistance, including food stamps, SNAP, and food for teenagers.

SITE_specific_location:
They have 2 food programs currently:  1) Distribution of food received from 412 Food Rescue, and 2) a hot meal program. 

1) The distribution of food will only be on Tuesdays for the next two weeks (March 31 and April 7). They plan to do food distribution the following week on Tuesday AND Thursday (April 14th and 16th). The food is for pick up.  They are only delivering to seniors. 

2) For a hot meal, you need to visit the website to register for a hot meal.  The specific times are on the website, which is between 5:00pm and 7:00pm. www.thisgenerationconnect.com

PublicNotes: All orders from the CMU Pantry include a standardized package of staple foods, including fresh produce, protein, canned fruits/vegetables, quick meals, soups, pasta/rice, potatoes, cereal, snacks, and miscellaneous items if available. All orders also include a cleaning/hygiene item. Additionally, shoppers are able to choose from a limited number of other items in the Pantry to customize their orders. Shoppers can fill out the online order form by visiting the CMU Pantry website.
Population_Served: The Carnegie Mellon University Pantry is a need-blind resource that is open only to current CMU students. All current students, including both undergraduate and graduate students, are welcome to visit our Pantry and take food once per week.

SITE_name: Pittsburgh Restaurant Workers Aid Food Distribution Center
SITE_specific_location: Please enter from the front at 5006 Penn Ave. A volunteer will greet you at the door.
Time: Tuesday-Sunday 1-5pm. Please visit our Facebook page for more info on special distribution events or to request a delivery to your home.
PublicNotes:
For restaurant and hospitality workers.
Please visit https://www.facebook.com/pghrestaurantworkersaid/ for up to date info.
Population_Served: Our Food Distribution Center serves restaurant and hospitality employees who have lost work due to Covid-19. We provide groceries, baby care items, pet food, and household products to our community. Please visit us at https://www.facebook.com/pghrestaurantworkersaid/ for more information and to let us know how we can help you during this difficult time.

POC_name: Lisa Pietrusza - Interpretation and translation services available.
SITE_name: Louisa Way Take What You Need
SITE_specific_location: Accessible on Louisa Way, look for neon green signage on street and house with large mural.  Small outdoor pantry located on wall in front of red fence.  Accesible en Louisa Way, busque letreros de neón verde en la calle y en la casa con un gran mural. Pequeña despensa al aire libre ubicada en la pared frente a la valla roja.
Time: Self serve.  Available 24 hours per day, 7 days per week.Autoservicio. Disponible las 24 horas del día, los 7 días de la semana.
PublicNotes: Selection of pasta, noodles, rice, canned vegetables and fruit, canned beans, canned meat, sauce, bread, ready to heat meals, peanut butter, hygiene, and cleaning products.  Replenished daily. Selection may vary.  No refrigerated or frozen items.  Bags tied to fence.  Need something specific?  Please leave a note in notebook provided.   Selección de pastas, fideos, arroz, verduras y frutas enlatadas, frijoles enlatados, carne enlatada, salsa, pan, comidas listas para calentar, mantequilla de maní, productos de higiene y limpieza. Reabastecido diariamente. La selección puede variar. No hay artículos refrigerados o congelados. Bolsas atadas a la valla. ¿Necesitas algo específico? Por favor, deje una nota en el cuaderno proporcionado.
SITE_address1: Between 501-510 Louisa Way. (Rear of 437 Carl St.)

SITE_specific_location: Distribution will be in the parking lot. his event will practice social distancing. Our team will be wearing masks and we ask that you please do the same.

SITE_specific_location: Use accessible entrance off Oliver Avenue.

PublicNotes: Emergency food and toiletries distribution

SITE_specific_location:
Drive-up food distribution. Each vehicle will receive one food share (at least 50 pounds of food) per vehicle. Due to the high demand for assistance, to ensure as many people receive food as possible, we must adhere to this policy. The Food Bank will be able to serve up to 600 vehicles at this distribution. 
Each vehicle will receive one food share (at least 50 pounds of food) per vehicle. Due to the high demand for assistance, to ensure as many people receive food as possible, we must adhere to this policy. The Food Bank will be able to serve up to 600 vehicles at this distribution.
Time: Thursday, June 11th from 10 am - 12 pm
PublicNotes:
The Food Bank is asking individuals to follow these guidelines:
For everyone’s safety, individuals attending the distribution must stay in their vehicles at all times. This will help us maintain six-foot social distancing guidelines. Leaving cars to socialize is strictly prohibited.
After pulling into “distribution row”, please put your vehicle in park and unlock your trunk or backseat for food to be loaded. Volunteers will not load food into vehicles until they are in park. Please stay in your vehicle.
Attendees will not be required to fill out a registration form in order to receive food.

SITE_specific_location: Drive-up or walk-up food distribution. No contact pick-up.
Time: Friday, June 12th from 1 pm - 3 pm
PublicNotes: Fresh produce and dairy boxes for anyone in need

SITE_specific_location:
Drive-up food distribution. Each vehicle will receive one food share (at least 50 pounds of food) per vehicle. Due to the high demand for assistance, to ensure as many people receive food as possible, we must adhere to this policy. The Food Bank will be able to serve up to 750 vehicles at this distribution. 
For the safety of the staff and volunteers working to set-up the event, those attending the event are asked to arrive no earlier than when the event starts at 1 p.m. Those who arrive prior to 1 p.m. may be asked to return at that time. The distribution will end promptly at 3 p.m.
Time: Tuesday, June 16th from 1 pm - 3 pm
PublicNotes:
The Food Bank is asking individuals to follow these guidelines:
For everyone’s safety, individuals attending the distribution must stay in their vehicles at all times. This will help us maintain six-foot social distancing guidelines. Leaving cars to socialize is strictly prohibited.

SITE_specific_location:

Due to the high demand for assistance, to ensure as many people receive food as possible, we must adhere to this policy. The Food Bank will be able to serve up to 1,000 vehicles at this distribution. 
For the safety of the staff and volunteers working to set-up the event, those attending the event are asked to arrive no earlier than when the event starts at 11 a.m. Those who arrive prior to 11 a.m. may be asked to return at that time. The distribution will end promptly at 1 p.m
